title: Top-level selection mode for atari
description:
# Description
Add a "top-level" selection mode to atari that prioritizes work at the root level of the ownership graph. Instead of picking beads globally by priority, atari selects the highest-priority top-level item (epic or standalone bead) and completes all its ready work before moving to the next.

# Key Decisions
| Decision | Choice |
|----------|--------|
| Default mode | top-level (not global) |
| Top-level includes | Epics AND standalone beads |
| Priority source | Item's own priority field |
| On exhaustion | Clear active, re-select all |
| On all complete | Auto-close epic, move on |
| --epic interaction | --epic takes precedence |
| Persistence | Yes, verify on resume |
| Eager switch default | false (complete before switching) |

- bd-btd: State persistence and controller integration

title: Add end-to-end tests for enrichment flow
description:
# Overview
Add tests that exercise the complete enrichment pipeline with realistic fixtures, including partial and total failure scenarios.

# Problem
Current tests either:
1. Use mockFetcher that returns pre-enriched data (bypasses enrichment)
2. Use fixtures that include dependencies br list does not provide
3. Do not test what happens when enrichment fails

# Implementation

## New Tests (fetcher_test.go)

1. TestBDFetcher_FetchActive_EnrichmentFlow
   - Setup: br list returns unenriched data (GraphListActiveJSON)
   - Setup: br show returns enriched data for each bead
   - Verify: dependencies populated after FetchActive
   - Verify: hierarchy edges can be extracted

2. TestBDFetcher_FetchActive_PartialEnrichmentFailure
   - Setup: br list returns 3 beads
   - Setup: br show fails for 1 bead, succeeds for 2
   - Verify: 2 beads have dependencies, 1 uses basic data
   - Verify: partial hierarchy visible

3. TestBDFetcher_FetchActive_TotalEnrichmentFailure
   - Setup: br list returns beads
   - Setup: br show fails for ALL beads
   - Verify: WARN logged with failure count
   - Verify: graph still displays (flat, but functional)

4. TestBDFetcher_FetchActive_ContextCancellationMidEnrichment
   - Setup: br list succeeds
   - Setup: cancel context after first br show
   - Verify: returns error promptly
   - Verify: no goroutine leaks

## Test Pattern

func TestBDFetcher_FetchActive_EnrichmentFlow(t *testing.T) {
    runner := testutil.NewMockRunner()
    runner.SetResponse("br", []string{"list", "--json"}, []byte(testutil.GraphListActiveJSON))
    testutil.SetupMockEnrichment(runner, testutil.GraphShowFixtures)
    
    fetcher := NewBDFetcher(runner)
    beads, err := fetcher.FetchActive(context.Background())
    
    require.NoError(t, err)
    // Verify enrichment populated dependencies
    for _, bead := range beads {
        if bead.ID == "bd-task-001" {
            require.NotEmpty(t, bead.Dependencies)
        }
    }
}

# Acceptance Criteria
- Tests exercise real enrichment code path
- Partial failure scenario tested
- Total failure scenario tested
- Context cancellation tested
- Tests use realistic fixtures from Issue 3

# Dependencies
- Requires Issue 3 (realistic fixtures)
- Requires Issue 4 (Parent fallback) for proper hierarchy verification

- mise run test passes

title: Add context check in fetchOutOfViewDeps loop
description:
# Overview
Add context cancellation check between iterations in fetchOutOfViewDeps to allow timely cancellation when fetching multiple out-of-view dependencies.

# Problem
In internal/tui/graph.go:121-130, fetchOutOfViewDeps loops through missing dependency IDs and fetches each sequentially. If context is cancelled, it is not detected until the next FetchBead call. With many missing IDs, this delays cancellation response.

# Implementation

## Code Changes (graph.go:121-130)

Before:
for id := range missingIDs {
    bead, err := g.fetcher.FetchBead(ctx, id)
    // ...
}

After:
for id := range missingIDs {
    select {
    case <-ctx.Done():
        return beads, outOfViewIDs // Return partial results
    default:
    }
    bead, err := g.fetcher.FetchBead(ctx, id)
    // ...
}

## Test

Add test that:
1. Sets up graph with dependencies pointing to out-of-view beads
2. Mocks FetchBead to block until signaled
3. Cancels context after first fetch
4. Verifies function returns promptly with partial results

# Acceptance Criteria
- Context checked between each fetch iteration
- Partial results returned on cancellation
- No unnecessary fetches after cancellation
- Test verifies prompt cancellation response

# Verification
- mise run lint passes
- mise run test passes
close_reason: Added context cancellation check in fetchOutOfViewDeps loop. Returns partial results on cancellation instead of blocking. Test verifies prompt cancellation with blocking mock fetcher. Lint and tests pass.

title: Fix ObserverPane height calculation bug
description:
ObserverPane View and SetSize methods calculate history height incorrectly, resulting in 2 lines of wasted space at bottom of panel. This causes autoscroll to position content halfway up with blank space below.

Root Cause: Both methods subtract 3 for status and padding but actual layout only needs 1 for status bar. Formula should be p.height - observerInputHeight - 1.

Implementation:
1. Change historyHeight calculation in View from -3 to -1
2. Change historyHeight calculation in SetSize from -3 to -1
3. Update comments to describe what is being accounted for

Files: internal/tui/observer_pane.go - View and SetSize methods

Acceptance Criteria:

- Autoscroll positions content at actual bottom of panel
- Existing tests pass

title: Fix event scroll bounds (visibleLines)

# Description
The visibleLines() function in model.go uses full terminal height even in split layouts, causing incorrect scroll bounds for the events pane. This results in users not being able to scroll to the true bottom of events and auto-scroll behavior being wrong.

- visibleLines() (model.go:381) returns `max(1, m.height-8)` regardless of layout

6. Ensure updatePaneSizes() runs before scroll handling to avoid stale values
7. Reset cache when switching between split/fullscreen layouts

- internal/tui/model.go - visibleLines(), add cache field
- internal/tui/view.go - set cache during render
- internal/tui/update.go - scroll bounds use cached value

title: Upgrade enrichment failure logging to WARN
description:
# Overview
Change enrichment failure logging from DEBUG to WARN level so failures are visible in production. This is critical for diagnosing why parent-child hierarchy appears flat.

# Problem
In `internal/tui/fetcher.go:163-168`, when `br show` fails during enrichment, the error is logged at DEBUG level and silently swallowed. This makes it impossible to diagnose enrichment failures in production.

# Implementation

1. Change `slog.Debug` to `slog.Warn` for non-cancellation errors (line 165)
2. Keep `context.Canceled` errors at DEBUG level to avoid spam
3. Add aggregate warning after enrichment completes: "N of M beads failed enrichment"
4. Track failed bead IDs for debugging

## Code Changes

`internal/tui/fetcher.go:163-168`:
```go
// Before
slog.Debug("failed to enrich bead, using basic data", ...)

// After  
if errors.Is(err, context.Canceled) {
    slog.Debug("bead enrichment cancelled", "bead_id", bead.ID)
} else {
    slog.Warn("failed to enrich bead, using basic data", "bead_id", bead.ID, "error", err)
    mu.Lock()
    failedIDs = append(failedIDs, bead.ID)
    mu.Unlock()
}
```

After `wg.Wait()`:
```go
if len(failedIDs) > 0 {
    slog.Warn("enrichment partially failed", "total", len(beads), "failed", len(failedIDs), "failed_ids", failedIDs)
}
```

# Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Non-cancellation enrichment errors logged at WARN level
- [ ] Context cancellation errors logged at DEBUG level
- [ ] Aggregate warning logged when any enrichments fail

title: Fix Parent field fallback and dependency_type handling
description:
# Overview
Add fallback edge creation from GraphBead.Parent field when Dependencies array is empty. Also fix brittle string matching for dependency_type.

# Problem
1. GraphBead.Parent field exists but is never used for edge creation - only Dependencies array is used
2. If enrichment fails, beads retain basic data with Parent field but no Dependencies, losing hierarchy
3. dependency_type matching is exact string (line 168), vulnerable to case differences

# Implementation

## Parent Fallback (graph_types.go:163-179)

After processing Dependencies array in ExtractEdges(), add fallback:

if b.Parent is set AND no parent-child edge was created from Dependencies,
synthesize a hierarchy edge from Parent to this bead.
Deduplicate to avoid double edges when both sources agree.

## dependency_type Normalization (graph_types.go:168)

Use case-insensitive matching:
- strings.EqualFold(dep.DependencyType, "parent-child")
- Also match "parent_child" variant
- Treat missing/empty dependency_type as EdgeDependency (not hierarchy)

## Code Changes

graph_types.go ExtractEdges():

func (b *GraphBead) ExtractEdges() []GraphEdge {
    var edges []GraphEdge
    hasParentEdge := false
    
    for _, dep := range b.Dependencies {
        edgeType := EdgeDependency
        depType := strings.ToLower(dep.DependencyType)
        if depType == "parent-child" || depType == "parent_child" {
            edgeType = EdgeHierarchy
            if dep.ID == b.Parent {
                hasParentEdge = true
            }
        }
        edges = append(edges, GraphEdge{From: dep.ID, To: b.ID, Type: edgeType})
    }
    
    // Fallback: use Parent field if no parent-child dependency found
    if b.Parent != "" && !hasParentEdge {
        edges = append(edges, GraphEdge{From: b.Parent, To: b.ID, Type: EdgeHierarchy})
    }
    
    return edges
}

# Acceptance Criteria
- Parent field used as fallback when no parent-child dependency exists
- No duplicate edges when Parent and Dependencies agree
- Case-insensitive dependency_type matching works
- Missing dependency_type treated as non-hierarchy
- Tests cover all variants

# Verification
- mise run lint passes
- mise run test passes
close_reason: Implemented Parent field fallback in ExtractEdges(): creates hierarchy edge from Parent when no parent-child dependency exists. Added case-insensitive dependency_type matching (parent-child, parent_child variants). Tests cover all cases including deduplication. Lint and tests pass.

title: Fix scroll position invalidation on resize
description:
When the observer pane is resized, the viewport YOffset can become invalid, causing scroll to break.

Root cause: ObserverPane.SetSize() (observer_pane.go line 530) rebuilds content with updateViewportContent() but does not preserve or clamp scroll position. Word wrapping changes line count, potentially making old YOffset out of bounds.

Implementation:
1. Use bottom-anchor pattern: save viewport.AtBottom() state before resize
2. After content rebuild, if was at bottom, call viewport.GotoBottom()
3. Otherwise, clamp existing YOffset to valid range (0 to totalLines - viewportHeight)
4. Do not attempt proportional restoration (too complex, deferred)

Files: internal/tui/observer_pane.go (SetSize method)

Edge cases: Resize when height becomes 0 or very small, empty history (no content), resize while streaming response

Explicitly deferred: Proportional scroll restoration for mid-scroll positions. Using simple clamp is sufficient and avoids edge case bugs.
